www.maddartcreative.comMaddart Creative is a boutique design studio committed to engaging clients and creating meaningful experiences through beautiful, innovative work. Maddart Creative collaborates with clients to solve communication problems and bring ideas to life through branding and identity, print and digital design, visual app design, and web design. Founded by Brittany Rislund, Maddart Creative aims to bring agency knowledge and expertise to the one-on-one relationships that Brittany builds with her clients as a freelancer. Working with pretty much anyone, from entrepreneurs to small and medium sized businesses in a range of industries, the Phoenix native is hell-bent on pushing boundaries and redefining the creative process. Services include:  • identity and branding• print design• UX visual design for web and mobile applications• WordPress sites• front-end web development• digital design for ad campaigns and social media• environmental graphics• vehicle wraps... and more!

gigapult is a new marketplace for the gig economy that connects employers with the gig workforce.Learn more, follow our journey, and sign-up for updates at gigapult.com✓ Seed Spot 2017 Evening Program (seedspot.org)✓ ASU+GSV Summit 2018 (asugsvsummit.com)

www.phoenixcomicon.comPhoenix Comicon is Arizona’s biggest pop culture convention, attracting more than 100,000 visitors over a four-day event.Started with the organization by volunteering as the Marketing Art Coordinator in November of 2013. As of December 2016, Square Egg Entertainment switched to a paid staff and contractor model. Now acting as a contracted senior designer:• Collaborate with Marketing Director and Art Manager to establish the look and feel of Phoenix Comicon and generate consistent and cohesive assets that represent the brand• Ensure brand consistency is maintained across all print and digital platforms• Provide front-end web design and development support for the company website• Create production templates to streamline process and ensure fast-paced deadlines are met• Design large works for convention including environmental graphics for entrance, wayfinding and banners, and backdrops for celebrity and featured panels• Manage and produce a high volume of digital designs for social media and web each year

www.imbrittany.comAs a contract designer, I collaborate with clients and other agencies to help solve communication problems and bring ideas to life with fresh and impactful visual design. Many projects I work on include:  • identity and branding• print design• UX visual design for web and mobile applications• WordPress sites• front-end web development• digital design for ad campaigns and social media• environmental graphics• vehicle wraps... and more!

www.eekostudio.comeeko studio is a Phoenix-based, design and branding boutique committed to working with business, large or small, who are hell bent on having a positive impact on their community. We work to solve communication problems through fresh design and solid marketing strategy.• Managed between three and eight projects at any given time while acting as main point of contact for our clients• Principal designer for projects including identity and branding, print and digital design works, and UX design for web and mobile applications• Lead and collaborated with a team of designers, developers, and copy editors for large scale projects from discovery through concept and design and to execution• Created project timelines and deadlines and ensured deliverables were delivered on time• Estimated project hours and cost, working with clients to find the best solutions within their budget• Interviewed, hired, and mentored design interns to help them grow and learn effective industry skills and trends

www.phoenixcomicon.comPhoenix Comicon is Arizona’s biggest pop culture convention, attracting more than 80,000 visitors over a four-day event.• Lead and collaborate with a team of ten designers• Work directly with Marketing Director and Art Manager to establish the look and feel of Phoenix Comicon and generate consistent and cohesive assets that represent the brand• Delegate and manage daily and weekly projects to team to produce hundreds of digital designs for social media and web each year• Create production templates to streamline process and ensure fast-paced deadlines are met• Design large works for convention including environmental graphics for entrance, wayfinding and banners, and backdrops for celebrity and featured panels• Ensure brand consistency is maintained across all platforms

www.phoenixfilmfestival.comNamed one of The 25 Coolest Film Festivals by MovieMaker Magazine, PFF is a program of the 501c(3) non-profit Phoenix Film Foundation. The eight-day event showcases independent filmmaking and attracts over 25,000 attendees.• Took a hiatus for the 2016 festival, but am back for 2017!• Work directly with Festival Director, Art Director, and three other designers to establish the upcoming year’s theme• Design posters that set the theme for the year, including reproducing to fit large format banners that hang on the building’s exterior• Resize and format artwork into smaller posters, badges, flyers, ads and other print collateral based on previously conceptualized theme elements for the current year• Ensure consistency for the theme and brand is maintained across all platformsView more creative work for the 2014 Phoenix Film Festival here: http://bit.ly/1ndzH7S

Volunteered as the community artist to plan, sketch, and draw a 6 ft. by 4 ft. gridded piece that each member of the community could come by and contribute to. Also did any finishing painting work needed.Images of the artwork at the event and finished piece can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.511708772224267.1073741825.466616446733500&type=1&l=1d467d25b2Event description as taken from feastonthestreet.org:"Feast on the Street brings our community and friends together around a half-mile long dining table in downtown Phoenix, transforming First Street into a pedestrian promenade in celebration of food and art in the desert. This free public event is a community project initiated by the ASU Art Museum and the Desert Initiative, Roosevelt Row CDC and the artists Clare Patey and Matt Moore. Supported in part by ArtPlace, the National Endowment for the Arts, Roosevelt Row CDC and The Steele Foundation."

August 15, 2014, Shaun worked with Brittany in different groups

As the Promotions Manager at Nerd Block Inc., Brittany was responsible for managing the Promotions Team and ensuring that our marketing and promotions were run according to plan. She coordinated how we reached out to websites, groups, and other outlets to get the Nerd Block brand out to our target demographics. Brittany had approval over the designs I created for these promotions and while she usually did not have many edits, the ones she wanted often carried a rationale that I could get behind. She was a pleasure to work alongside, approachable, professional, and firm when need be in order to run a team and execute a gameplan.

summary: Hi there! I'm Brittany, a Phoenix native who's a nerd and design junkie. Check out some examples of my work at imbrittany.com and maddartcreative.com/Maddart-Creative-Sample-Portfolio.pdfI'm the founder and creator of things at Maddart Creative, a boutique design studio committed to engaging clients and creating meaningful experiences through beautiful, innovative work. With over 8 years in the industry and through Maddart Creative, I'm able to bring agency experience and knowledge to the one-on-one relationships I build with my clients. I collaborate with my clients and other agencies to help solve communication problems and bring ideas to life with fresh and impactful visual design in branding and identity, graphic, app, and web.  Nicknamed "hawkeye" by my peers, I have a heightened sense of detail and work hard to execute great design. I'm constantly trying new ideas, learning, and pushing boundaries so that I can stay on top of the latest trends and grow beyond. I happily welcome new challenges and look forward to projects that call for innovation.As a self-proclaimed nerd, I've found a way to combine both my loves of design and nerd culture by volunteering as Art Coordinator with Phoenix Comicon. I have a slight addiction to collecting Funko Pops, figures, and other memorabilia from various fandoms. When I’m not in front of the computer or buying things on Amazon, I’m likely found enjoying time with those closest to me, riding my bike, indulging in coffee, or playing with my dogs, Maddox the pug and Arthur the rescue.Let's connect and create something awesome!
name: Brittany Rislund
title: Founder and Principal Designer of Maddart Creative, Co-Founder at gigapult
